column4: Hello all.. i am currently running Ubuntu 10.4 on my pc, however i would like to downgrade it to Ubuntu 9.10. how do i do that?
hmmm.. ok. is that the only option? :(
issues like, it gives error messages  when the system is rebooting..
what's the error you are getting?
i am a newbie.. i honestly dont remember the error message either.. i dont get the error message always.. but somestimes yes.. i do get the, where i am forced to give a cold reboot  my machine.

the most common issue being.. once  my machine boots.. it takes me to a black screen.. with a blinking cursor.. and then it gives a error message ( which i have not made a note of ) and the caps lock and the scroll lock lights on my keyboard starts flashing.. and my system becomes unresponsive.
do you get the list of earlier version of kernels at grub boot menu?
how do i identify the list of earlier version of kernels  in my boot menu?
after updating, the newest version of kernel will be on the top.. and the older version will go to the bottom..
are u reffering to the grub menu which i get at boot up?
so try if you can boot in properly with older version of kernel
older version of kernel.. that worked properly..
if you don't remember the version, just boot into the oldest available kernel in the grub boot menu

how do i identify the oldest available kernel in the boot menu? i know u will feel like killing me for my most stupid questions on earth.. i am really sorry bro. but i really appreciate  you helping me to get this fixed.
the newest version of kernel will be on the top.. and the older version will go to the bottom..
perfect! thank u so much.. let me try that and get back to u . :)
